verb.description: Turn or hold (a hand, foot, or limb) so that the palm or sole is facing upward or outward.
examples: the clinician notes the magnitude of force that is required to supinate the foot from its resting position

origin: Mid 19th century (earlier ( mid 17th century) as supination): back-formation from supination, from Latin supinatio(n-), from supinare lay backwards, from supinus (see supine).
